fragment.title: Alrik Cockpit - a new way for a TMS to scale with expontential customer growth
fragment.desc: Alrik started small, with customers that handled around 10 orders daily. As the compant grew, so did the amount of orders the customers needed to handle. This is the project that made Alrik adapt to that growth. And introduce AI to construction logistics.

research.title: Planners need to be able to see the big picture of their orders
research.desc: Kanban view used before only shows a couple of orders at a time and seeing orders that can be delivered in the same delivery route is impossible.

research.title: No feedback on the progress on the delivery drivers progress
research.desc: Where are my drivers right now? Are they gonna deliver on time? Is there anyone available at the moment? There were a lot of questions unanswered for planners to optimize their deliveries.

research.title: Planners had no idea if they planned a good, or bad, delivery route
research.desc: A lot of planners needed to use third party services to check addresses in order to get an understanding if the delivery route was good, or bad.
